Class Sarz

  • java.lang.Object
    • Sarz

  • public class Sarz
extends java.lang.Object

    Sarz++, the 21st Century Text Adventure

    The Sarz class carries the bulk of the game, generating the actual functons which will be called. This class houses the actual "Map" of the game, in which we will make the player navigate.

    • Method Detail

      • clearScreen

        public void clearScreen()

      • checkRowBounds

        public int checkRowBounds()
        This method is used to see whether or not the player is going to navigate outside of the defined array, which if done could basically destroy the game. The method is called at the end of each and every move that the player inputs, and sees the integer value which the user is at. If it is too far, it does indeed give an error.
        Returns:
        the userRow is returned, which allows us to push the person back to the array that they were in. This, then, allows the user to input a different "Direction" from the location that they originally made the decision.

      • checkColumnBounds

        public int checkColumnBounds()
        This method has the same theory as does the checkRowBounds(); method, but instead checks the columns.
        Returns:
        returns the userColumn value of the "previous state" of the column; exactly like the userRow but with columns.

      • setPlayerName

        public java.lang.String setPlayerName()
        This Method asks for the user's player name.
        Returns:
        userName, just returns the userName to be called elsewhere.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        This method is invoked to clear anything that has been changed in the game to its original value.

      • mapGeneration

        public void mapGeneration()
        This method generates the array in which the game takes place, and uses an array to dimensinoalize this. This then calls in other generate functions in order to gnerate Enimeies and Fruits at Random places on the map, allowing for a more dynamic game.

      • getWeapon

        public int getWeapon()
        This method is a panel which reads in information between the two weapons. Then, it asks the user which one they want.
        Returns:
        returns user choice.

      • encounter

        public void encounter(Sarz array)
        This function tells whether or not two objects are colliding with one another.
        Parameters:
        array - initiliazes object position in array

      • itemEncounter

        public void itemEncounter(Sarz array)
        This method tells the user when the key items needed to win the game are picked up.
        Parameters:

      • enemyAttack

        public void enemyAttack(Sarz array)
        This method tells the user any info needed about the enemy, including the enemy's HP, their name, and then tells the user whether their attempt to run away - or their HP after attacking - was sucessful or resulted in death, respectivley.
        Parameters:

      • battleWin

        public void battleWin(Sarz array)
        This method checks who dies: you or the enemy, and the overall winner of the battle.
        Parameters:
